definition: imminent danger (idiom); approaching a crisis
lofty peak/perilous
lofty peak/perilous
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
surname Wei
danger/to endanger/Taiwan pr. [wei2]

sentences.english: It is worth noting that the report also found the American border to be atr isk.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，报告同时发现，美国边界亦岌岌可危。

sentences.english: America's machine-tool industry was on the ropes.
sentences.chinese: 美国的机床工业是岌岌可危了。

sentences.english: But even then, she cautions that you're walking a precarious line.
sentences.chinese: 即使如此，她也顾虑你走在一条岌岌可危的路上。

sentences.english: As a weak country surrounded by powerful neighbors, North Korea's external position looks dire.
sentences.chinese: 身处强邻围绕之中，朝鲜的国外形势似乎岌岌可危。

sentences.english: But now those plans appear to be in peril.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在，这些计划似乎都岌岌可危。

sentences.english: As China modernizes, many traditional beliefs become endangered.
sentences.chinese: 随着中国的现代化发展，许多传统信仰变得岌岌可危。

sentences.english: Looking up at his nose, I saw snot dripping.
sentences.chinese: 我抬头看着他的鼻子，发现有块鼻屎岌岌可危。

sentences.english: But organic food is so popular that its value system is in  jeopardy.
sentences.chinese: 但是有机食品很受欢迎，它的价值体系也岌岌可危。

definition: precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
isolated and without help
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to collapse/to fall apart
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
to preserve/to save
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
